skill.name: multi-agent-patterns
skill.description: Design multi-agent architectures for complex tasks. Use when single-agent context limits are exceeded, when tasks decompose naturally into subtasks, or when specializing agents improves quality.
skill.summary: Design multi-agent architectures for complex tasks. Use when single-agent context limits are exceede...
skill.author: Asmayaseen

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation and reference skill with no executable code. Contains markdown documentation and Python example patterns for multi-agent architectures. All code is read-only reference material with no network, filesystem, or execution capabilities.

content.value_statement: Single-agent systems struggle with complex tasks that exceed context limits. Multi-agent architectures distribute work across multiple specialized agents, enabling parallel processing and better context isolation. This skill provides patterns and implementation guidance for building production multi-agent systems.
actual_capabilities: Implement supervisor/orchestrator patterns for centralized coordination
Design peer-to-peer swarm architectures with direct handoff protocols
Create hierarchical agent structures with strategic, planning, and execution layers
Apply context isolation principles to partition work across agents
Build consensus mechanisms including weighted voting and debate protocols
Handle failure modes with circuit breakers and checkpoint recovery
limitations: Does not execute agent workflows or connect to external APIs
Does not provision or manage actual agent instances
Does not provide runtime execution environment
Requires integration with framework libraries like LangGraph or AutoGen

use_cases.title: Build production agent systems
use_cases.description: Design scalable multi-agent systems that distribute reasoning across specialized agents for complex workflows.

use_cases.title: Coordinate parallel research
use_cases.description: Architect research teams of agents that work in parallel on information gathering and analysis subtasks.

use_cases.title: Scale beyond context limits
use_cases.description: Partition complex tasks across multiple context windows when single-agent limits constrain capability.

prompt_templates.title: Basic supervisor pattern
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a supervisor pattern for coordinating multiple agents. Include task decomposition, worker selection, and result aggregation.

prompt_templates.title: Swarm handoff protocol
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement a peer-to-peer swarm pattern with explicit handoff protocols. Show how agents transfer control and state.

prompt_templates.title: Hierarchical architecture
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a hierarchical agent architecture with strategy, planning, and execution layers. Define communication between layers.

prompt_templates.title: Consensus mechanism
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement weighted voting or debate protocols for consensus among agents. Include confidence scoring and expertise weighting.

output_examples.input: How do I design a multi-agent system for research tasks?
output: Architecture: Supervisor pattern with researcher, analyzer, and writer agents
Each agent has specialized tools and system prompts
Supervisor decomposes tasks and routes to appropriate workers
Context isolation ensures each agent operates in clean context
Results aggregate at coordination layer with quality scoring
Failure handling with circuit breakers prevents cascade failures

best_practices: Design for context isolation as the primary benefit of multi-agent systems
Choose architecture pattern based on coordination needs, not organizational metaphor
Implement explicit handoff protocols with state passing and validation
anti_patterns: Using supervisor patterns without direct pass-through mechanisms causes fidelity loss
Overloading single context with accumulated state defeats multi-agent purpose
Ignoring error propagation between agents leads to cascade failures

faq.question: Which frameworks does this skill cover?
faq.answer: Covers LangGraph, AutoGen, and CrewAI patterns with implementation examples for each.

faq.question: What token overhead should I expect?
faq.answer: Multi-agent systems typically use 15x more tokens than single-agent approaches. Plan budget accordingly.

faq.question: How do I integrate this with my codebase?
faq.answer: Use the code examples as templates. Copy patterns and adapt to your framework and requirements.

faq.question: Is data safe with multi-agent systems?
faq.answer: Data flows between agent contexts based on your design. Implement isolation boundaries explicitly.

faq.question: What happens when an agent fails?
faq.answer: Implement circuit breakers and retry logic. Route tasks to alternative agents when failures exceed threshold.

faq.question: How is this different from tool use?
faq.answer: Tools extend single-agent capability. Multi-agent systems partition context across separate reasoning instances for scale.
